5.0 out of 5 stars Gripping, 23 Nov 2013
By 
HelenK - See all my reviews
Amazon Verified Purchase(What is this?)
This review is from: Escape (Kindle Edition)
I wasn't sure how thrilling a short thriller book would be to be honest, but I was wrong, very wrong. It really was gripping and I read it in a few short hours over two nights as I wanted to find out what happened next. Would thoroughly recommend and hope this exciting new author writes a new book soon!

1 of 1 people found the following review helpful
5.0 out of 5 stars Great read, 22 Nov 2013
By 
Mark Murphy - See all my reviews
Amazon Verified Purchase(What is this?)
This review is from: Escape (Kindle Edition)
The word `escape' has many connotations. To escape to the sun from a hard knock life? To escape from some jeopardy? Maybe! Or perhaps a multitude of other meanings. With clever twists in this debut book we are kept guessing. This new author clearly has a way with words - and a clever title to boot.

It is written with style and grace. Not having been to Menorca myself, where the novel is set, I could imagine being there from the descriptions of the picturesque vistas and I felt I was really going to like it here. If this author is an orphan for a publisher I would suggest she won't be an orphan for long.

I read the novel in one sitting - I just couldn't wait for tomorrow.

I was left wondering what will happen in the sequel. Who will tie up the loose ends and solve the mystery? More from the existing characters or perhaps we will need the FBI?

I was impressed with this novel and I am I sure it will have the same effect on everyone.

I would say one word to our author C.H. Little - more!
Help other customers find the most helpful reviews 
Was this review helpful to you? Yes No
Report abuse | Permalink

Kath Smith - See all my reviews
Amazon Verified Purchase(What is this?)
This review is from: Escape (Kindle Edition)
A gripping story from the outset, the characters were well drawn and the setting of Menorca so nicely portrayed. I thoroughly enjoyed it. A brilliant debut novel by this author. I can't wait for the next one.

5.0 out of 5 stars Escape with escape, 3 Dec 2013
By 
S Ebert - See all my reviews
Amazon Verified Purchase(What is this?)
This review is from: Escape (Kindle Edition)
What starts as a warning to women, of the dangers of investing too much in a relationship that is going nowhere, soon twists and turns beyond recognition and becomes a tangle of mystery and terror. A heroine with intelligence and fight, who pulls no punches, is refreshing and you can't help but will Penny to succeed in her quest to find a new life. But, be warned! If you have ironing to do, don't even pick this book up. Once you've started reading it, you won't be able to put it down.
